alert.note: Alert for Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 05 at 8:54PM CST until March 06 at 2:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CST FOR ROCK ISLAND...NORTHEASTERN MERCER...NORTHWESTERN HENRY...EASTERN SCOTT AND SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 853 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near DeWitt to near Bettendorf to near Sherrard, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Camanche, Port Byron, Rapids City, Princeton, Cordova, Low Moor, Silvis, Clinton, Cleveland and Osborn. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across eastern Iowa. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
